metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18314 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Perl before 5.26.3 has a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expression that triggers invalid write operations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libperl5.26 - 5.26.1-6ubuntu0.3
perl - 5.26.1-6ubuntu0.3
perl-base - 5.26.1-6ubuntu0.3
perl-debug - 5.26.1-6ubuntu0.3
perl-modules-5.26 - 5.26.1-6ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: upstream> 5.18 - 5.28 mdeslaur> trusty doesn't look affected

criterions.comment: perl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.26.1-6ubuntu0.3').
